revised_title: Radioimmunoassay of Angiotensin II: A Breakthrough in Hormone Detection
tldr: The authors developed a radioimmunoassay technique to detect angiotensin II in blood plasma. They created a specific antibody against free angiotensin II by immunizing rabbits with angiotensin II adsorbed on micro-particles of carbon. This method allowed them to measure angiotensin II levels in various physiological and pathological states, providing a better understanding of the hormone's role in the body.
